page.title: 17Birds in Loose Valley
page.content: The stream that runs through the Loose Valley attracts less common birds like the Kingfisher, Heron, Grey Wagtail, Reed Bunting and the Water Rail. Also, ponds and parts of the stream have the commoner water birds like the Mallard, Coot and the Moorhen. Other rarer birds that visit the valley are the three types of woodpecker, the Little Owl, the Snipe and the Goldcrest. The most common birds seen are the House Sparrow, Starling, House Martin, Song Thrush, Blackbird, Swallow, Goldfinch, Wren and Swift. Winter visitors include the Black-headed Gull and the Common Gull. Unfortunately, Barn Owls have not been seen in the valley since 1983.
